intro: Miconia mutabilis, commonly known as the variable miconia, is a tropical shrub or small tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Melastomataceae and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range from pink to purple. The plant produces small, round fruits that are typically dispersed by birds. Its leaves are usually opposite and have a velvety texture. Miconia mutabilis is often found in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests.
